Bio:
Adam Berry is a senior chemical engineering major with a minor in business. His professional interests are product development and energy storage research.

On campus, he is the Vice President of AIChE and is involved in the CUROSE saxophone quartet. He also performs research in the Joo lab synthesizing silicon-based nanofibers towards a better Li-ion battery.

This past summer, he worked at 3M in their Industrial Adhesives and Tapes division as an R&D / Product Development intern. The previous summer, he worked in Germany at the University of Ulm researching better magnesium battery electrolytes. In the summer of 2015, Adam worked at the International Institute of Nanotechnology researching feasible permanent magnet alternatives. When not working, he loves to hike around campus and play the saxophone.

Richa is currently a Senior studying Computer Science with a minor in Information Science from New Jersey.

On campus, she is involved in a range of organizations that align with her passions. She is a member of WICC (Women in Computing at Cornell) as the past Publicity Director, past Community Discussions Director, past Social Events Director, and currently Advisor. She is a teaching assistant for INFO 4240 Designing Technology for Social Impact this semester and a member of Kappa Kappa Gamma.

Her professional interests include combining her passion for software with helping people around her. This past summer she was a software engineering intern at Microsoft. In her free time she enjoys shopping, learning new things, and helping others.

Addison is a senior from Charlotte, North Carolina studying Materials Science and Engineering and minoring in Business.

On campus, she is a tour guide, a member of Pi Beta Phi sorority, co-hosts a podcast for the Cornell Daily Sun, and works for Cornell University Sustainable Design, a design-build project team focused on social, ecological, and economic sustainability.

Professionally, she is busy investigating the entrepreneurship landscape, and has worked for startups including Dog Parker and Avant Garb. In 2016, she was a hardware engineering / business analyst intern at Entrepreneurs Roundtable Accelerator, and in 2017 she used her Kessler Fellowship to explore the west coast at Mucker Capital in Santa Monica, California.

Nicholas is a senior from Warren, NJ, studying Operations Research and Engineering with a minor in Business.

This past summer, Nicholas was interning at BNP Paribas in their Global Markets division. The summer before he worked at ExxonMobil improving their demand forecasting. On campus, Nicholas serves as a Leader of Cornell's Autonomous Underwater Vehicle Business/PR subteam and has served as both New Member Educator and Professional Development Chair of Theta Tau. He is also involved in Cornell's International Affairs Society. In his free time, Nicholas likes to play soccer, ski, keep up on the news, and watch comedy shows.

Marco Bustamante is a junior from Thessaloniki, Greece studying Mechanical Engineering. In the future he dreams of working in product design and manufacturing. On campus, Marco is a 2017 Kessler Fellow and a member of the Varsity Lightweight Rowing team.

The summer after his freshman year, he represented the United States at the Under-23 World Rowing Championships. This past summer, he spent half his time rowing for Cornell at Henley Royal Regatta in the UK, and the other half interning with Urnex Brands as a Production Engineer in their factory.

When Marco is not studying or at the boathouse, he can usually be found either spending quality time watching movies or working out.

Andrea is a senior from Woodbury, MN studying Biological Engineering with a minor in Biomedical Engineering while following the premed track.

In high school Andrea worked at a community pool and would love to return to her position after graduation, but unfortunately her parents will not let her renovate their basement to be her own apartment. Andrea instead hopes to apply her skills of rocking an oversized flannel, making cringe-worthy puns and being utterly confounded by technology to grow up to become a great dad. She greatly values her role as regent not only as training for fatherhood but also because it includes gavel privileges.

Andrea's proudest accomplishments to date include: being pledgemaster to the Lambda class, owning a fantastic baseball hat collection, and having 500+ connections on LinkedIn.

Saie is a senior majoring in Biological Engineering and minoring in Biomedical Engineering. In the past, she served as the Cornell iGEM team lead. She is president of Alpha Epsilon Honors Society, works on North Campus as an RA, researches in the Putnam Lab, and is on the E-board for Engineering Ambassadors. A recent graduate of the Cornell Engineering Leadership Program, Saie is a TA for the program this year.

Last summer, Saie interned at P&G in Cincinnati and realized very quickly after a visit to an amusement park, that she despises rollercoasters with a passion. In her free time, Saie loves to bake seasonal desserts, knit long never-ending scarfs, and hammock.

Junie is a senior studying Operations Research and Information Engineering.

Last summer, she interned at Capital One as a Business Analyst Intern in the Commercial Bank. Previously, she has interned at the Federal Communications Commission and the National Institutes of Health.

On campus, Junie is a Commissioner for the Student Assembly Funding Commission, which is responsible for the funding of almost all Cornell student organizations. She also serves on the SAFC eboard as Webmaster.

Megan is a senior from Princeton, New Jersey studying Mechanical Engineering. Last summer she worked at Jaros, Baum, and Bolles as a HVAC intern in NYC. She is currently interested in the intersection of the MEP and architectural industries. On campus she is a mechanical lead for Cornell Cup Robotics team. She is also a part of the Panhellenic community, the Society of Women Engineers, and Engineering Ambassadors. In her spare time she enjoys watching low quality foreign TV shows, eating unhealthy snacks, and reading.

Amelia is a junior from Great Falls, Virginia studying Chemical Engineering, hoping to minor in Southeast Asian Studies.

She spent the last summer as a research assistant for the Netravali Group in the school of Fiber Science, tour guide for the College of Engineering, and Stand Up Paddle Board Instructor. Having worked on projects concerning hydrophobic denim and biodegradable composites, she hopes to work in consumer products, specifically with bioplastics and other means of sustainable packaging. Elsewhere on campus, she is heavily involved in Cornell Outdoor Education as a Rock Climbing Instructor and Outdoor Odyssey Guide, Cornell's FM radio station WVBR 93.5 as a Radio Show Host and Promotions Team member, and her social sorority.

Outside of school you can catch her cooking with friends, climbing at the wall, or attempting to learn Spanish on Rosetta Stone.

Sean is a Junior from Iselin NJ, majoring in Computer Science.

Over the past year and a half, he has worked at a startup, Wellth working on combating insurance fraud and improving patient adherence. As an iOS developer he developed a uber-ish app to connect home aid nurses to elderly patient while providing real time tracking and monitoring to prevent fraud. As a web developer he worked on creating a dynamic dashboard to monitor and manage chronic disease patients.

On campus, Sean is the Cornell Mars Rover Business Team lead and Cornell Piano Society. In his free time he enjoys gymnastics, lifting and watching basketball.

Luke is a senior from Philadelphia, PA majoring in Operations Research and Information Engineering. Luke is a member of Theta Tau's most distinguished pledge class, the Kappas. He spent last summer in Ithaca working for Student Agencies, Inc. as President. On campus, Luke also is an active member of his social fraternity, Sigma Chi.

Erin is a junior studying Computer Science from Lexington, MA.

Last summer, she was a software engineering intern at Akamai Technologies in Boston, where she built a web application to view anomalous activity across Akamai's platform network. Prior to that, she helped develop a brain visualization tool as an undergraduate researcher at Purdue. This coming summer, she will intern on Squarespaceâ€™s Core Services software team.

At school, she is the Vice President and Software Team Lead at Cornell Engineering World Health, a project team that creates engineering solutions for global health problems. In the future, she hopes to combine her interests in computer science and health technology.

In her spare time, Erin enjoys reading books and the news, biking outdoors, photography, baking and cooking, and trying new cuisines.

Lindsey is a Junior from Wayne, NJ studying Mechanical Engineering with interests in the Aerospace, Automotive, and Oil Industries.

On campus she is a suspension sub-team member of the Cornell FSAE Racing Project Team, a defensive player for the Lady Bears Club Volleyball team, and currently serving as the Philanthropy Chair for Theta Tau.

This past summer Lindsey interned at Phillips 66 at the Bayway Refinery in Linden, NJ as a Maintenance Engineering Intern on the Fixed Equipment and Reliability Team.

When she's not working in Duffield you can find her playing board games, crafting, discovering new foods, frolicking with Katrina and laughing at her bad jokes, chasing dogs around campus, or acing Francis and digging his hits on the volleyball court.

Andrei is a junior from Somers, NY studying Engineering Physics with interests in quantum information processing, photonics, and aerospace engineering. He hopes to pursue a PhD in electrical engineering or applied physics and a career in research and development in industry.

He currently works in the Wise Group in Engineering Physics studying nonlinear fiber optics. In the past he has been part of the Vengalattore experimental cold atom group in the Laboratory of Atomic and Solid State Physics, where his research focused on the fabrication of optical nano-fibers used to characterize micro-resonators for precision sensing. In the past Andrei has worked in a photonics research group at the University of California San Diego and was a member of the Violet Satellite project team.

On campus, Andrei is a beatboxer for the Red Solo acappella group. He is also a Mountain Biking instructor for Cornell Outdoor Education and has worked as a teaching assistant for PHYS 2213: Electricity and Magnetism.

Eric is a senior studying Electrical and Computer Engineering, with a minor in Computer Science.

Last summer Eric worked as a summer analyst with Blackstone in their Innovations and Infrastructure group. He previously worked for SRC, Inc. where he developed a web application for use in electronic warfare, and at StartFast Venture Accelerator, where he did mobile development for multiple startups in the program. Additionally Eric has done freelance development with Belle Apps.

On campus, he is involved in his social fraternity and works part-time at the Johnson Graduate School of Management. Also, Eric is the current Treasurer of Theta Tau. In his free time he likes to read and build new things.

Katrina is a senior from Bellport, NY studying Mechanical Engineering with a focus in Biomedical Engineering. She is currently the Vice Regent of Theta Tau and, since ending her reign as President, she is currently the Director of Publicity/Marketing for SHPE.

This past summer Katrina ventured to the West Coast as a Mechanical Engineering intern at BAE Systems, a military defense contracting company, conducting design, integration, and test work for amphibious combat vehicles.

In the future Katrina hopes to work in the biomedical industry handling medical devices or prosthetics. In her spare time she likes to explore nature with friends, annoy Lindsey with her bad jokes, and eat ice cream.

Anna is a junior from Long Island, New York, in the College of Agriculture and Life Sciences. She is majoring in Environmental Engineering with interests in Energy, Architecture, and Sustainable Design.

For the past two summers, Anna worked as an Energy Intern for Vidaris, an Environmental and Structural Engineering firm in New York City. She worked closely with the Energy and Green Teams and learned how to implement concepts regarding Energy Use, Renewables, and Lighting. Anna is also a Project Lead for CUSD's Smithsonian Energy Audit, where she is analyzing and providing recommendations to the Cooper Hewitt Smithsonian Design Museum on how to improve their building sustainably and efficiently.

Aside from school, she enjoys traveling, playing soccer, cooking (and cleaning), and napping.

Cody is a Senior studying Computer Science with minors in Electrical and Computer Engineering and Business.

The summer of 2017, he interned at Amazon as a Software Development Engineer. He has also interned at Medidata Solutions and IBM the previous summers.

On campus, Cody is currently the Profesional Development Chair of Theta Tau and is involved in CSA. Previous semesters he was the Webmaster of Theta Tau and was involved in Intel-Cornell Cup project team and club soccer and track.

During free time, he likes to go on spontaneous adventures and take risks.

Hiking-Photography-Piano-Music

Charlene is a senior from Maple Grove, MN studying Operations Research and minoring in Applied Math.

Last summer, Charlene interned at Morgan Stanley in Project Management/Business Analytics. Previously, she has worked at BNY Mellon and BOPU Hedge Fund (in Hong Kong). Although she spent the past few summers in finance, she is looking to explore other data science options (and grad school) in the future.

Charlene also works in the Udell Research Group in the OR Department, where her research focuses on using Generalized Low Rank Models to improve music recommendation systems. Apart from that, she's a member of Kappa Delta, captain of Women's Club Volleyball (sports!), and was the former Art Director of The Thread Magazine (fashion!).

During her free time (free time?), Charlene loves to make playlists on Spotify (294 and counting) and go to concerts. She also loves to cook, eat the food she cooks, and feed the food she cooks to friends.

Pehuen is a junior studying Computer science with interest in robotics and computer vision. He hopes to pursue a career in robotics research and development. Last summer, he worked in the robotics lab here at Cornell developing software and hardware for socially assistive robots. In the past he was worked on websites and applications for startups and small businesses. He is also a new member of the Cornell Autonomous Bicycle team.

Outside of academics Pehuen is a kayaking instructor for Cornell Outdoor Education and a member of Cornell Mundial F.C. In his free time he enjoys whitewater kayaking, experimenting in the kitchen, and hammocking.

Jad is a senior from Beirut, Lebanon studying Computer Science with a minor in Business. On campus he is the president of the Arab Student Association and a Resident Fellow on West Campus.

Last summer he worked at Google as an Associate Product Manager intern, and the summer before he worked at Graphiq (recently acquired by Amazon) as a Product Manager intern.

Erica Sadler is a junior from Laurel, MD studying Biomedical Engineering.

This past summer, Erica worked as an undergraduate researcher for the National Institute of Arthritis, Musculoskeletal, and Skin Diseases. There she was involved in a project using CRISPR/Cas9 technology to knock out the genes associated with the Mediator complex. Erica has done previous research at the Johns Hopkins Proteomics Laboratory and the University of Pennsylvania's GRASP Laboratory.

On campus, Erica is an undergraduate researcher in the Adie Lab, which focuses on biomedical imaging, and is a member of Alpha Xi Delta. In her free time, she enjoys hanging out with friends, staying active, watching trashy TV, and drinking too much coffee.

Annie is a junior AEP major from Charlottesville, Virginia. On campus, she is a member of the varsity cross country and track teams as a distance runner and steeplechaser, an undergraduate researcher in the Lambert Lab for Quantitative Single-Cell Biophysics, and is working on an electrooculogram for device control as a personal project. Annie has previously interned with Orbital ATK and Analytical Mechanics Associates.

Joe Wetzel is a sophomore in the College of Engineering, majoring in Civil Engineering and minoring in Business. On campus, he is a member of the Cornell Steel Bridge project team, and involved as an Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in the Physics department.

Over the past few years, Joe has worked as a District Office intern for U.S. Congressman Steve Israel, and been involved with environmental engineering research at Hofstra University. This past summer he continued studying at Cornell.

Joe is from Northport, New York, and in his free time he enjoys running, watching movies, and supporting FC Bayern Munich.

Joseph Adas is a junior from Amman, Jordan studying Mechanical Engineering with professional interests at an intersect between product design and manufacture. His on-campus involvements include employment at the Upson machine shop where he will often be found, a position on the Baja Racing project team, and assisting with research work.

Last summer Joe worked on tooling management and manufacturing process design at Sensata Technologies in Attleboro, MA as a mechanical engineering intern. The summer before, Joe worked on a personal engineering project in the context of his work with watchmaking and repair.

In his free time outside of classes and his extracurriculars, Joe pursues watchmaking and playing guitar as two of his personal interests.

Kat Bau is a sophomore from Queens, New York studying Computer Science in the College of Engineering, hoping to minor in Feminist Gender and Sexuality Studies.

On campus, Kat is involved in CUAir as their resident marketing lead, Camp Kesem as Volunteer Coordinator, where she trains the 2017 counselors to prepare them to spread Kesem magic. She is also Theta Tau's current marketing chair.

When she isn't working, Kat loves spoken word poetry and cackling away with Jinghan in Duffield.

Giacomo is a junior from Northport, New York, studying Electrical and Computer Engineering. On campus, he is the treasurer of the Cornell Mock Trial Association and is also a TA for Digital Logic (ECE 2300/ENGRD 2300).

This summer Giacomo worked in the Computer Systems Laboratory with Professor Zhiru Zhang. He worked with image processing by implementing an optical flow algorithm in a high level Domain-Specific Language Halide. Giacomo also taught a class on quantum physics to high school students this summer as a part of the CAU summer camp in Ithaca.

Giacomo is interested in attending law school after graduating from Cornell in order to practice intellectual property law.

Ben Gassaway is a Junior from Lumberton, NJ studying environmental engineering. His career interests in engineering include alternative energy and sustainability. Ben hopes to pursue a career as an environmental attorney later in his career. On campus, Ben is a member of Lightweight Rowing and works for the College of Engineering Alumni Relations.

The summer following freshman year, Ben interned at Monmouth Physics Associates working with medical devices and radiopharmaceuticals. The summer after his sophomore year, he worked for Bristol-Myers Squibb in the Global Energy Services division.

When Ben isn't worried about his future, you can find him at the beach skimboarding with friends, or on Spotify looking for fresh tunes.

Kara is a junior from San Ramon, CA studying Materials Science and Engineering with a minor in International Relations

This past summer, Kara was a Materials Development Intern at Stratasys formulating new materials for the recently released F123 3D printer series. Her work focused on FDM thermoplastics for both functional and conceptual prototyping.

On campus, Kara is a member of the project team Design/Build/Fly in the Stability & Controls subteam as well as an undergraduate researcher for Professor Darrel Schlom. She is also an Engineering Peer Advisor, on a social sorority, and one of the Socials for Cornell Materials Society. In her free time, Kara enjoys watching 90s chick flicks, Friends, and anything pre-2000.

Peter is a Junior Mechanical Engineering student from Abu Dhabi, UAE (ethnically Lebanese/American).

Most recently, he was a Mechanical Engineering MEP intern at Turner Construction and specifically worked on the HVAC systems involved the Rockefeller University River Building expansion project in New York City. In the past, he has also worked at Ghesa Ingenieria y Technologia S.A. on the various water features involved in Abu Dhabi's Presidential Palace.

Other than his involvements in Theta Tau, he is the Mechanical sub-team lead of the Cornell ChemE Car project team and is in charge of designing, manufacturing and assembling the chassis that the team uses, as well as troubleshooting problems that may arise during the vehicle's operation. Peter is also affiliated with Cornell Music Vs, a non-profit organization that brings students and performance groups to the elderly and young, effectively building connections through music.

In his free time, he enjoys producing/DJing music (https://soundcloud.com/peter-haddad-1), playing the piano, traveling the world and hitting the tennis courts every so often.

Yeolim is a junior from Brookline, MA majoring in mechanical engineering. On campus she is a drivetrain member of Cornell Baja Racing and a paddleboard instructor for Cornell Outdoor Education. This past summer, Yeolim interned at Hyperloop One in Los Angeles, CA as an intern with the Electromagnetic Systems team, working on the mechanical design of a levitation test rig.

Yeolim is interested in design engineering, manufacturing, controls, and R&D, and hopes to acquire a wide variety of skills and experiences in the future.

Francis is a junior from Clifton, NJ studying Chemical Engineering with a minor in Biomedical Engineering, hoping to earn a Ph.D. and become a professor.

This past summer, Francis conducted research at the University of California, Berkeley as a member of the 2017 NSF REU Integrative Biology Program. He worked with Dr. David Sedlak in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering. His project focused on removing dissolved metals from urban stormwater using manganese oxide-coated sand. His work contributed to a larger effort to increase water security in urban areas.

The previous summer, Francis became a member of Dr. Christopher Alabi's lab on campus, researching drug delivery techniques. His project focuses on developing polymers to characterize nanoparticle surface proteins by detecting specific protein clusters. His group hopes to use this technique to adapt nanoparticles as targeted drug delivery vehicles, with a wide range of applications in the medical field.

Outside of research, Francis is the principal tuba player of the Cornell Symphony Orchestra and the Cornell Wind Symphony. Additionally, he is a TA for ENGRI 1120: Intro to Chemical Engineering. He is also an Outdoor Odyssey guide, leading incoming freshmen on pre-orientation wilderness trips to help their transition to Cornell, and serving as Selection Chair during the year. Francis also serves as an Engineering Peer Advisor, mentoring freshmen engineers. He is a Junior Representative for the American Institute of Chemical Engineers (AIChE) chapter here on campus. His fun-loving side has led him to serve as Social Chair for Theta Tau. Finally, Francis is currently a member of the Cornell Engineering Leadership Certification Program.

At the rare times Francis is not studying in Duffield, you can find him sleeping in his hammock, exploring and questioning the intricacies of the universe and society, spending time with friends, or blocking Lindsey and spiking his way to victory on the volleyball court.

Kenta Takatsu is a junior from Westchester, NY, studying Computer Science with a minor in Engineering Statistics. His academic interest is the application of machine learning in the context of social interactions.

Professionally, he has worked with 2 startups where he assisted in building deep learning models for image recognition. This past summer, he was a software engineering intern at Akamai Technologies, where he proposed a new learning-based ranking algorithm.

On campus, he is a project lead for the Yelp Dataset Challenge of Cornell Data Science, and a co-lecturer for their workshop series. Also, he is an undergraduate researcher at the Social Dynamics Lab, where he conducts machine learning research using Twitter dataset to study social impacts of technologies.

In his free time, he dances with BreakFree HipHop, for which he serves as Dance Director, watch films, and study Haiku. He secretly dreams of running a coffee shop in Hawaii after his retirement.

Kelly is a senior from Charlotte, North Carolina studying Biomedical Engineering with a concentration in Molecular, Cellular, and Systems Engineering.

Last summer, she interned at Merck & Co., Inc. with the Barrier Operations sector of Bacterial and Biological Manufacturing. On campus she is a member of the Orientation Steering Committee, is a tutor for the STEP and Upward Bound Programs, and is the head of the tech committee for Colleges Against Cancer.

In her free time, Kelly enjoys sleeping, watching movies, and consuming exorbitant amounts of fruit snacks.

Jing Han is a sophomore from Sugar Land, TX studying Biomedical Engineering, and hoping to minor in English. Her professional interests lie in reconstructive surgery and tissue engineering.

This past summer, she worked in Brito Lab at Cornell studying the interactions between host and microbe proteins in the human gut. On campus, she is also a part of Donnelly Lab, where she researches the effects of Diabetes on bone structure, and Design Build Fly, a project team thatâ€”as the name suggestsâ€”designs, builds, and flies rad planes.

When she has free time, which she never really does, you can find her taking naps in Duffield.

Kyra Conroy is a sophomore from Naperville, IL studying Operations Research Engineering. Her career interests are broad and include consulting, nonprofit work, and sustainability.

Last summer, Kyra worked as an Industrial Engineer at Ideal Industries. At Ideal, her main projects were to improve ergonomic packaging, conduct time studies, and implement automatic data acquisition technologies.

On campus, Kyra is an Odyssey Guide, an Ambassador, and of course, a part of the best Theta Tau pledge class - the Mu pledge class.

Outside of these involvements, Kyra likes to quite literally be outside. She enjoys trail running, paddling, and hiking, as well as any sport under the sun. She also enjoys writing bios in the third person.

Joanna is a junior from the Greater Boston Area, majoring in Biomedical Engineering and minoring in Business.

This past summer, she was an Image Analysis Intern at the Psychiatry and Neuroimaging Lab at Harvard Medical School. Her work included writing programs to analyze brain scans from patients with mild to severe traumatic brain injuries, using the technology of Diffusion Magnetic Resonance Imaging. She also worked with a startup in 3D printing, which focused on creating customized orthotic products. In the past, she has worked for Brigham and Women's Hospital, conducting research on orthopedic nanotechnology.

On campus, she is involved with Engineers for a Sustainable World: Biofuels, Engineering World Health, and is the Academics Chair for Theta Tau. Joanna is also a TA for introductory biology classes. Outside of Cornell, she enjoys hiking and exploring new places.

Jordan is a junior from Tampa, FL studying Chemical Engineering.

Last summer Jordan worked at Goldman Sachs in their Global Investment Research division, working on initiating on a stock in the specialty retail sector. In the past, Jordan has researched in the DeLisa lab, where she worked on engineering antibodies to recognize carbohydrate antigens.

On campus, Jordan is the junior team captain of ChemE Car, a junior rep for AICHE, involved in the Student Assembly Diversity Committee, and on the recruiting team for Cayuga's Watchers. Also she is a teaching assistant for Introduction to Chemical Engineering and one of the Professional Development chairs for Theta Tau.

In her free time, Jordan enjoys sleeping, doing yoga late at night in Duffield, and crocheting scarves.

Brian is a Junior from Queens, New York, studying Computer Science.

This past summer, Brian worked at a startup in New York City called Yaalo, where he created a social media application centered around building a network for contractors and freelancers. He also went to a conference called IC3, where he learned about and programmed smart contracts on the Ethereum blockchain.

On campus, Brian is a Teaching Assistant for Operating Systems, as well as a member of the Phenomenon Step team and the webmaster for Theta Tau. In his free time, Brian likes to watch Game of Thrones, thread his eyebrows, and read books.

TK is a sophomore from New York City studying Information Science, Systems, and Technology.

This past summer, he worked as a Product Design Intern at Mantl, a fintech startup that gives banks the flexibility to innovate using modern technology. He also spent 4 weeks in Italy, participating in the 2017 Italia Innovation Program where he worked as a design consultant for Deâ€™Longhi Group, a small domestic appliances manufacturer.

On campus, TK is a member of the CUAUV Business subteam and is a product designer on CUAppDev. He is also a social chair for his social fraternity and the marketing chair for Theta Tau.

In his free time, TK likes to play soccer & volleyball, snowboard, watch action movies, and eat lots of sweets.

tkkong.me/

Perry is a Junior from Long Beach, CA studying applied and engineering physics and minoring in computer science. He spent the past summer in Ithaca working three different jobs. He worked in one of Mason Peck's labs working on the ECE sub-team of the Cislunar Explorers group, developing software for a satellite set to be launched into lunar orbit in 2019. He also taught a Summer Camp class called Rockets and Robots to children from eight to ten years old about the basics of, you guessed it, rocketry and robotics. His last project was a continuation of his job from last Summer in which he collaborated with a group headed by two professors at UCLA to develop and format material for an online textbook service called Coursapp/Kudu. Perry is also the secretary for Cornell Audio Engineering Society, an on-campus club focused giving its members opportunities to learn about any form of audio engineering by designing and building all kinds of projects related to the field. Outside of his academics, Perry enjoys reading the occasional book, hiking, rock climbing, and checking meh.com for his newest impulse purchase.

Justin is a Junior studying Computer Science. He has grown up in Thailand, New Jersey, Ohio, Malaysia, Singapore, and the Philippines, which is where he currently lives.

This past summer, Justin interned at Adobe Systems Inc. as a software engineer in their digital marketing team. Previously, he has interned at Uber Manila and Proctor & Gamble Singapore. On campus, Justin is a tour guide, a member of a social fraternity, and on the design sub-team of Engineers Without Borders.

In his free time Justin enjoys going to the gym, laying on roofs, and being a law abiding citizen. His professional interests include product management and his unprofessional interests include dogs, pasta, and sushi.

Michael Xiao is a sophomore from Blacksburg, Virginia, studying Electrical and Computer Engineering and minoring in Business. On campus, he is a subteam lead within the Biofuels project team and the Vice President of Communications of Engineers for a Sustainable World. In addition, Michael is part of the Shepherd Lab, where he researches the application and design of soft robotics.

This past summer, Michael continued his work in the Shepherd lab creating a pneumatic orthotic hand for paralyzed patients and also taught an engineering course with Cornell Adult University. He hopes to pursue a career in product design or management.

Outside of the classroom, he enjoys rock climbing, soccer, and building new things.

MartÃ­n is currently a senior studying mechanical engineering and is from Orlando, FL.

On campus he is a team lead of Design, Build, Fly and a 2016 Kessler Fellow. He spent last summer interning at Shaper Tools in San Francisco working on design and test engineering. The previous summer he worked at Lockheed Martin in supply chain. In his spare time he enjoys film, sketching, cooking, board games, working on personal projects, and picking up new skills.

A senior mechanical engineer/NBA all star, Deepthi spent her last summer away from the courts and in Pittsburgh at Uber ATC as a hardware intern working on design and testing. In the past, she has also worked at Federal Mogul, a back end automotive company in Plymouth, Michigan as well as at StreetView in Google's Mountain View campus. This upcoming summer, she is very excited to be joining Google X's Self Driving Team. During the school year, Deepthi is one of the three team leads for Cornell's Baja Racing team and enjoys making frequent trips to the dairy bar.
